activities.message:
Hi @qwqw thank you for a detailed report. Unfortunately, CSRF in our blog.starbucks.com comment section was previously reported to us by another researcher. :(

That being said, I am closing this report as `Duplicate`.

Thank you for participating in our program. We look forward to more reports from you in the future.
@rockyrobot
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @qwqw thank you for a detailed report. Unfortunately, CSRF in our blog.starbucks.com comment section was previously reported to us by another researcher. :(

That being said, I am closing this report as Duplicate.

Thank you for participating in our program. We look forward to more reports from you in the future.
@rockyrobot

activities.message: You can give me thanks and rating in my account? I found three vulnerabilities, but they are marked as duplicates https://hackerone.com/reports/198393 https://hackerone.com/reports/198390 . it's dropped my signal to -1, and now I cant submit reports.
activities.markdown_message: You can give me thanks and rating in my account? I found three vulnerabilities, but they are marked as duplicates https://hackerone.com/reports/198393 https://hackerone.com/reports/198390 . it's dropped my signal to -1, and now I cant submit reports.

activities.message:
Hi @qwqw, based on my understanding of HackerOne metrics, signal is based on the average reputation per report. I am not sure how `Duplicate` is exactly handled but you can always take a look at your [log](https://hackerone.com/settings/reputation/log) and see why there was a signal drop. At the moment, I cannot see how we can add more reputation point to your account because it is solely based on report's reputation which we closed as `Duplicate`. 

If you have any questions regarding how the reputation system works please reach out to support@hackerone.com.

Here is also link to HackerOne Blog that describes how reputation works in the platform: https://hackerone.com/blog/introducing-reputation

Thank you,
@rockyrobot

activities.message:
Please keep in mind that the Starbucks bug bounty program has been around for a while before joining HackerOne. That said, there's a chance that some of these vulnerabilities may have been found already.

Since this vulnerability hasn't been fixed yet, we are going to have to cancel the public disclosure until further notice. Thank you for participating in the Starbucks bug bounty program. We look forward to more reports from you in the future.
